==Applies To==
* iOS applications that send or receive sensitive data over the network.
==What to Do==
Use SSL to protect network communications.
==Why==
Properly using SSL to encrypt network communications prevents eavesdropping attacks. Other types of Man-in-the-middle attacks may also be prevented by using SSL.
==How==
To use SSL to protect communications:
# **Identify all communications performed by the application.** Review the application design to identify all network communications that are performed by the application. # **Define communication security requirements.** Define which network communications need to be encrypted. All transmissions that include sensitive data should be encrypted. In some cases, it might be practical to encrypt all network connections. # **Identify code that uses the network.** Identify code that is responsible for each network communication that needs to be encrypted. # **Add code that uses SSL.** Add code that uses SSL to code that performs network communications that need to be encrypted. The //NSURLRequest// and //NSURLConnection// classes support SSL with an acceptably secure default configuration starting with iOS 5 - this is the most practical way to use SSL on iOS and should be sufficient for most applications.
